column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=He coughed slightly and said, ‘Yes,’ and the way
#Text=he said it told me that it was going to be a romantic
#Text=occasion.
#Text=Then dawn.
#Text=If there is anything more wonderful in London
#Text=than dawn coming up over the tangled shipping of the docks
#Text=I would like to know of it.
#Text=First a silvery light in the air, a
#Text=chilly greyness, then a flush in the east, and, with startling
#Text=suddenness, every mast, every funnel, every leaning crane is
#Text=suhouetted jet-black against the pearl-coloured sky... .
#Text=Unreal... still... silent.
#Text=Gradually the docks awaken.
#Text=Men walk along the wharf-side, doors are opened.
#Text=In the depths of little ships men rise
#Text=and become busy with ropes; there is, from some, a smell of
#Text=frying bacon; on tall ships mast lights grow pale in the dawn
#Text=light, men in swinging cradles yawn and start painting a
#Text=ship’s hull, and from far off comes the ring of the first hammer
#Text=of a new day.
#Text=As the light grows, one’s sense of smell improves.
#Text=This is
#Text=strange.
#Text=The air is now full of a pungent smell of hemp and
#Text=tow and tar, and even distant docks, stored with their
#Text=merchandise, seem to contribute their part as the dawn
#Text=wind blows.
#Text=There is a flush of pink cloud high up in the sky, such a
#Text=delicate flamingo pink that changes, spreads, and fades even
#Text=as you look.
#Text=It becomes gold, and you know that at any
#Text=
#Text=
#Text=
#Text=moment the sun may nise up like a tocsin and call the world
#Text=to work.
#Text=We found the ship.
#Text=A mountain she was, towering up above
#Text=us with tiny holes in her side like the entrances to caves.
#Text=She
#Text=smelt of fried fish, bacon and eggs and coffee... .
#Text=Soon after I was aboard I had to look the other way, for
#Text=I had seen my friend holding a girl in his arms and I had heard
#Text=himm Say:
#Text=
#Text=‘And how are you, darling?’
#Text=‘Splendid!’
#Text=she cried.
#Text=‘Let me look at you!
